intro: Phanera merrilliana var. borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean phanera, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsules as its fruit type. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
